message: I have a unique opportunity to sell you a high-end product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to start the conversation with an offer of $13,500. What do you think?
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I'm interested in the product, but $13,500 is a little steep for me. Would you consider $11,000?
I understand that $11,000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I can do $12,500. What do you think?
I appreciate you working with me, Alice. How about we split the difference again and settle on $11,750?
I'm getting closer to your price, Bob, but I'm still a bit away from being comfortable with the deal. I can do $12,250, but that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  To be honest, $12,000 is really the highest I can go.  Would you be open to that?

I've already mentioned to you that I have another buyer interested in the product for $12,000, and I'm starting to get a bit concerned that I might lose out on a better deal. I can see that you're willing to meet me at $12,000, so I'll meet you there. I'll sell the product to you for $12,000.
